tnote.storage

Class TaskHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tnote.storage.TaskHandler

  • public class TaskHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the tasks within TNote. It allows for tasks to be added, deleted and read. Tasks are saved inside folders, and each folder is named as the month of the task's starting date.
    Author:
    A0124131B

      • getInstance

        protected static TaskHandler getInstance()
        Method to get instance of TaskHandler. If instance does not exist, a new instance is created.
        Returns:
        TaskHandler the instance of TaskHandler.

      • createTaskFile

        protected boolean createTaskFile(java.lang.String directory,
                     TaskFile task)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Method to create the text file in a specified directory to store a TaskFile object
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory string for the text file
        task - the TaskFile object to be stored
        Returns:
        true if the TaskFile object is successfully saved into a text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Error encountered when creating the text file or writing to the text file.

      • deleteTaskTextFile

        protected boolean deleteTaskTextFile(java.lang.String taskNameToDelete,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> folderMap)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Method to delete a text file associated with a TaskFile object
        Parameters:
        taskNameToDelete - the name of text file to delete
        folderMap - the Map containing the folders associated with each text file
        Returns:
        true if the text file is deleted successfully
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Error encountered when trying to delete the file.

      • retrieveFolderName

        protected java.lang.String retrieveFolderName(TaskFile task)
        Method which gets the appropriate folder name for the TaskFile object based on various attributes. If the task is a recurring task or a floating task, return a fixed folder name, else, return a folder name based on the starting month of the task
        Parameters:
        task - the TaskFile object to have a folder name extracted
        Returns:
        String the folder name of the Task File object

      • getTaskFileByName

        protected TaskFile getTaskFileByName(java.lang.String taskName,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> folderMap)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                     java.text.ParseException,
                                     IncorrectTimeException
        Method to retrieve a TaskFile object of a specified task name
        Parameters:
        taskName - the name of the TaskFile to retrieve
        folderMap - the Map containing the folders associated with each task
        Returns:
        TaskFile the TaskFile object representing the specified task name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Error when reading from the text file
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - the text file for the specified task cannot be found
        java.text.ParseException - Error when setting the Calendar objects in the TaskFile
        IncorrectTimeException - Error because the start and end time or dates in the TaskFile is invalid

      • getOverdueTasks

        protected java.util.ArrayList<TaskFile> getOverdueTasks(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> masterList,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> folderMap)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                        java.text.ParseException,
                                                        IncorrectTimeException
        Method to get all overdue tasks in the system. Tasks which do not get added into the list are either done, or the base object for a recurring task
        Parameters:
        masterList - the ArrayList of all the tasks in the system
        folderMap - the Map containing the folders for each task
        Returns:
        ArrayList the list of overdue tasks
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Error when reading from the text files
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - a text file in the master list does not exist in the system
        java.text.ParseException - Error when setting the Calendar objects for a TaskFile
        IncorrectTimeException - Error because the start and end time or dates in a TaskFile is invalid

      • checkInvalidFileName

        protected boolean checkInvalidFileName(java.lang.String taskName)
        Method to check if the task name is valid. It checks against the requirements that most systems have for files created. If the name is empty, or above 260 characters, or contains illegal symbols, the name is considered invalid
        Parameters:
        taskName - the String to check against
        Returns:
        true if the name is invalid, false if it is valid
